frameDefinitions: A Wrongdoer engages in a Misdeed.
An Agent causes a Hidden_object to become perceptually inaccessible to potential perceivers by placing it in a Hiding_place or putting in place an Obstruction that screens the object.
An Obstruction blocks an Eclipsed entity partially or completely from view.

A Phenomenon is portrayed with respect to the Degree of likelihood that it will  be perceived and known, given the (usually implicit) Evidence, Perceiver, and the Circumstances in which it is considered.
A  Counter_actor or Cause  impedes an Agent in an Activity or impedes the unfolding or continuation of a State_of_affairs.
A Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a Message to some Addressee.
frameExamples: You have <t>sinned</t> for the last time, Stephen!
Therefore, as I passed the school, I <t>hid</t> the gun and holster in the mailbox
A small green bulb <t>concealed</t> behind the panel flashed on momentarily .
It's abundantly <t>obvious</t> that we'll need to spend more time on public perception.

However, as this story goes on the Queen of Sodom has a brother who
plans to <t>undermine</t> his sister and take the throne of Sodom.
She <t>affirmed</t> her loyalty to the cause.
listRoleDefinitions: This is the person whose <fen>Misdeed</fen> is being judged with respect to its morality.
The assessment of the <fen>Wrongdoer</fen> is based on his or her <fen>Misdeed</fen>.
The time at which a <fen>Misdeed</fen> is performed.
The location where a <fen>Misdeed</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is the entity which is blocked from view.
The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person who causes the Hidden_entity to be not perceptually accessible to potential perceivers.
The location in which the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> is placed so as not to be perceptually accessible.
<fen>Time</fen> denotes the interval of time during which the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the <fen>Hidden_object</fen> to become hidden from perceptual access.
The <fen>Place</fen> is the spatial setting in which the hiding event takes place.
The entity which blocks the <fen>Eclipsed</fen> entity from view.
The entity which is blocked from view.
The entity or facts that are undeniable given the <fen>Evidence</fen>.
The gradable aspect of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> which concerns how likely it is that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> be known. This frame element is incorporated by the lexical units in this frame.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Phenomenon</fen> in terms of how likely the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> would be known.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is obvious
An event or state_of_Affairs that successfully impedes an <fen>Agent</fen> or a State_of_affairs.
A person who intentionally or not acts in such a way that an <fen>Agent</fen> or State_of_affairs is impeded.
A person who is intentionally engaged in some <fen>Activity</fen> and who is impeded in that <fen>Activity</fen>.
An <fen>Activity</fen> that is being impeded.
A state or event that is ongoing and whose continuance or unfolding is impeded.
The time at which the <fen>Counter_actor</fen> or <fen>Cause</fen> works agains the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Counter_actor</fen> subverts an <fen>Activity</fen>.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'of' or about'.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
<fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
listRoleExamples: The misdeeds <fex>of the previous evening</fex> were all forgotten now.
Sexual peccadilloes <fex>in the White House</fex> are one thing, lying before Congress quite another.

Michael Jackson gave wine to the 13-year-old cancer patient at the center of
the molestation charges he's battling but concealed <fex>it</fex> inside a Coke can.
<fex>The deputy</fex> concealed the bayonet under his coat.
He had concealed the necklace <fex>behind him</fex>.
The mists obscured <fex>the top of the tower</fex>.
It is obvious for example <fex>that 9/10 is not the same as 1</fex>.
It is <fex>abundantly</fex> obvious you have not a clue how the Retro Program works.
It is obvious <fex>now</fex> that Senator O. T. Tawa has no plan.
Tory rebels queued to warn that <fex>they</fex> wouldsabotage efforts to put the treaty through Parliament .
If he is really undermining <fex>me</fex>, then he is a fine friend.
The Dominican Republic was widely held to have undermined <fex>its own efforts to become a full member of CARICOM</fex>
Whenever I try to quit they all try to sabotage <fex>my efforts</fex>.
No one believed <fex>Evelyn</fex>'s affirmation that she could speak to ghosts.
They refute the criticisms <fex>that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.
